Q1: Who was Charles J. Hunt?
A1: Charles J. Hunt was an American film editor and director.

Q2: What were some of the films directed or edited by Charles J. Hunt?
A2: Some of the films directed or edited by Charles J. Hunt include "The Fate of a Flirt," "The Smoke Eaters," "The Dixie Flyer," "The Warning Signal," "Modern Daughters," "The Show Girl," "On the Stroke of Twelve," "The Midnight Watch," "South of Panama," "Queen of the Chorus," "Thundergod," "Smoke Bellew," "Rider of the Plains," "Riders of the North," "Police Court," "Trailing the Killer," "Law of the West," and "The Devil on Horseback."

Q3: When was Charles J. Hunt born?
A3: Charles J. Hunt was born on April 8, 1881.

Q4: When did Charles J. Hunt pass away?
A4: Charles J. Hunt passed away on February 3, 1976.

Q5: What were some of the roles that Charles J. Hunt played in films?
A5: According to the passage, Charles J. Hunt worked as an actor, production manager, and associate producer in addition to his work as a film editor and director.

Q6: How many films did Charles J. Hunt direct or edit?
A6: According to the passage, Charles J. Hunt directed or edited 17 films between 1925 and 1936.

Q7: What was the name of the first film that Charles J. Hunt directed or edited?
A7: The first film directed or edited by Charles J. Hunt was "The Fate of a Flirt," which was released in 1925.

Q8: How many films did Charles J. Hunt direct or edit after his death?
A8: According to the passage, none of Charles J. Hunt's films were directed or edited after his death in 1976.

Q9: What was the name of the last film that Charles J. Hunt directed or edited?
A9: The last film directed or edited by Charles J. Hunt was "The Devil on Horseback," which was released in 1936.

Q10: How many years did Charles J. Hunt work in the film industry?
A10: According to the passage, Charles J. Hunt worked in the film industry for approximately 55 years, from 1925 until his death in 1976.
